snippet: Researchers uncover new dangers from smoking superheated electronic cigarettes.
abstract: Editorial warns that research paper to be published in journal Nicotine and Tobacco Research finds that some electronic cigarettes produce formaldehyde and other carcinogens; contends that Food and Drug Administration will need to crack down on products and practices that generate carcinogens that e-cigarettes are supposed to protect smokers from.
lead_paragraph: Researchers uncover new dangers from smoking superheated electronic cigarettes.
